intro: Pseudognaphalium saxicola, commonly known as the rock everlasting, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are typically clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Pseudognaphalium saxicola is drought-tolerant and has adapted to survive in harsh, sun-exposed conditions.
